answers.answer: The fasting cut off for diagnoses is 125.  You are past that, and so you would qualify for a diagnosis of diabetes.The good news is that the earlier you manage this the less likely you are to have complications and you can definitely slow the progression.For sure you need to see a Dr.  You should be considering medications (probably metformin) and also losing weight if you are overweight, increasing activity / exercise levels and eating a lower carb diet to help get this under control.

Do heard or read about treating that disease type with "a new molecular therapy that uses targeted peptides and proteins to restore cellular function".I recommend please do a Google search for the term "Peptide treatment", or the company named "Regenerative Cellular Therapy".

question: Hi, I am a male 47 yrs old and for the last couple of tests over two week period my fasting blood glucose level is 124 and 127 and po is around 150.  Pls advise whether I should consult a doctor and start medications?
title: Diabetes or not? And what should I do?
